clear disruption;15/12/2025;"Misinformation;";I work in a university
column3: and we use Turnitin to screen AI-generated text for students' assessment. On one occasion
column4: the system reported a high AI-generated sign
column5: but later the student was able to provide convincing evidence that the work was his own original work. So
column6: we believe an AI incident happened here. Turnitin should be responsible for this incident. The student was asked to attend a meeting with staff members to clarify the situation. The time and effort of the student and staff were wasted in this case.

column2: minor inconvenience;14/07/2025;"Misinformation;AI system failure;";"I was trying to make a normal payment using Amazon Pay
column3: but the transaction was suddenly blocked and marked as suspicious. I received an automated message with no clear explanation. Since I had used Amazon Pay many times before without issues
column4: this was confusing. I contacted customer support and later spoke to a human representative who said the system had flagged the payment by mistake. After verification
column5: the block was removed and I was able to complete the payment. However
column6: it caused delay and some stress at the time.

column1: I believe this involved an AI or automated decision system because the block happened instantly and was reversed only after manual review."

column2: critical impact;23/10/2024;"AI system failure;";A teenage boy was suffering from mental health problems
column3: and he confided in an AI chatbot that imitates other characters. The boy kept exchanging texts with the bot that kept reassuring him of his decisions
column4: and he eventually ended his life after only informing the AI bot of his next move. AI usage should be restricted to certain ages
column5: and it should be trained to deny or redirect talking about such sensitive matters with children/teenagers.

column2: no noticeable impact;01/06/2025;"Misinformation;";The AI system returned misinformation. This was noticed by a human so the incident was not that serious.

column5: and implemented fairness checks. Outcome: partial resolution

column2: minor inconvenience;04/05/2025;"Malicious intent;";"While working my engineering job in Western Australia
column3: I received an email and follow-up phone call that appeared to come from the regional manager
column4: requesting urgent approval to release traffic camera footage to an external ""consultant"" due to a supposed incident on a local highway. The email signature
column6: and the voice on the call closely matched that of the regional manager. However
column7: I quickly noticed that the request did not follow normal approval processes and contained minor factual and typographical errors in relation to some of our internal systems. I verified directly with said manager via MS Teams
column8: who confirmed he had not made the request. We believe the email and voice call were AI-generated to impersonate a known authority figure. The incident was reported internally
column9: and the sender details were blocked. Staff awareness was raised via an organization-wide email. No further contact from the perpetrators has been reported."

column2: clear disruption;4/12/2025;"Misinformation;";It was during our end year presentations when one of my colleagues used AI for factual research. she even made a Powerpoint with the numbers provided by AI only to realize that the in formation was wrong. our manager pointed it out during the presentation since he had the actual numbers. My colleague was embarassed since our partners were present in the meeting and this was deemed as lack of attention to detail. In an internal meeting held later on
column3: the manager enquired where she got her information from she had to come out clean. She explained that there was minimal time for her to conduct proper research. The manager however made it  clear that she needs to finish her reasearch days before her deadline and make sure the information fed in her presentation was as accurate as needed. She was given a warning letter for the misconduct and overrealiance to the AI system which is against company policies

column2: no noticeable impact;15/11/2025;"Misinformation;";"Country: France
confusion and loss of time
incorrect information

column1: I recently used ChatGPT for a university assignment to help me write a paper about a recent French legal topic. ChatGPT gave me information that sounded kind of confident
column2: including references to laws and legal reforms. Later
column3: I discovered that some of these laws or reforms did not exist or were described incorrectly.

column2: I used this information in a first draft of my work. During a discussion with my law mentor
column3: they pointed out that some of the legal sources were not real. I then checked the information myself and realized that ChatGPT had created references that sounded plausible but were false.

column1: The mistake was corrected before the final submission
column2: so there was no academic penalty. However
column3: it caused a significant loss of time and made me question how reliable ChatGPT is for specialized and actual informations. "

column2: clear disruption;24/12/2025;"AI system failure;";An AI merged with a robotic cleaner was cleaning the floor at a restaurant. The AI is designed to avoid coming into contact with any object or human. However
column3: in this case the robot ran into a person at the table in the restaurant

column2: clear disruption;17/12/2025;"AI system failure;Misinformation;";The AI gave me false information about a question for my microeconomics coursework. it was microsoft copilot and it did the complete wrong thing to solve the problem and as a result i got worse marks

clear disruption;13/11/2025;"AI system failure;";I used a booking system that used ChatGPT API with the use of AI extensions. I used it to get recommendations for restaurants and then used it to book a reservation at that restaurant. The extension notified me of the creation of the reservation and I even received a receipt but the reservation was never created. I ended up going somewhere else as a result. I believe it was through Booking.com? It was the first time I used it because I really like new technology (often bleeding edge cases) I think it was called Trip Planner or close in name.

clear disruption;18/12/2025;"Discrimination and toxicity;Misinformation;Malicious intent;";There were several posts in which AI was used to spread misinformation about Christmas Markets in Germany that were sealed off due to terrorist attacks. This was not only fake
column3: but also feeding to the existing Islamophobia
column5: also fearmongering. AI should be used for scientific advancements
column6: not to spread hate and fake information that can be harmful to millions. AI bots would boost these posts to make them more viral.

column2: clear disruption;17/04/2025-24/04/2025;"AI system failure;";The company policy uses automated systems for recording work hours for compensation purposes. On this specific day at my workplace
column3: I logged in as usual to the system to record the start of my work shift every day
column4: but the supervisor wasn't seeing the data on his end and said I wasn't coming to work frequently. I tried to explain myself
column6: he found out I've been coming to work every day and therefore suggested compensating me for the normal working hours.
